pageContext.claim: “President Obama received 3 million less in his second term, and he won easily. I received 12 million more, which, by the way, is a record. Twelve million more.”
pageContext.analysis: It comes down to turnout. "More Americans voted in the 2020 election — two-thirds of the voting eligible population — than in any other in 120 years," The Washington Post reported. "This turnout shattered previous highs, including 2008 when Barack Obama defeated John McCain, 1960 when John F. Kennedy defeated Richard Nixon, and 1908 when William Howard Taft defeated William Jennings Bryan. It is the highest turnout since 1900, when 73.7 percent of eligible Americans cast ballots."
